p: Again thrombus or blood clot ends up with severe consequences of thrombolytic issues like acute myocardial and cerebral infraction which can also lead to demise (Khan et al., 2013). Most of the thrombolytic agents possess significant shortcomings including bleeding tendency, limited fibrin specificity and requirement of a large dose to reach the maximum therapeutic effect (Khan et al., 2013). Studies carried out on herbs showed thrombolytic activity and a few remarkable observations have been reported (Basta et al., 2004; Khan et al., 2013; Bulbul et al., 2013).
